data.text: @nickmmark @GoogleTrends Driven by Russian bots and amplified by @JohnBoweActor
@nickmmark @GoogleTrends Oh, seems like if you replace #myocarditis with BLM you can draw the same conclusions https://t.co/DAKGGsMAM7

@nickmmark @luckytran @GoogleTrends So, if twitter accounts follow trend lines that means they're all Russian bots? That same logic could be applied to CNN's coverage trends or anything pertinent. Apply it to accounts mentioning Stimulus Checks, still works. Therefore, there are no poor people, only Russian bots!
@nickmmark @GoogleTrends Very scientific Nick! Write it up, I'm sure Lancet will publish it

@hoaxeye @BRXBIS @nickmmark @GoogleTrends @CCDHate @hoaxeye
I leave this as a reminder.

@hoaxeye @BRXBIS @nickmmark @GoogleTrends @CCDHate This is an exaggeration using GoogleTrends.
I will show you a duplicate of a similar one I created.
It is not proof that a malicious BOT spread the information.
We believe that a forensic explanation using time stamps is required for the claim that a BOT was involved on Twitter. https://t.co/151xkrrGCO
